program main

   implicit none

   integer, parameter :: M = 1000000007

   integer :: n, a, b, i, j, tmp, x, count, current_char_ascii, current_char

   integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: list1

   logical, dimension(:), allocatable :: present

   character(len=20) :: count_str

   character(len=20) :: s_str

   integer :: m

   integer, dimension(:,:), allocatable :: dp

   ! Read first part's input

   read*, n, a, b

   allocate(list1(a))

   read*, list1(1:a)

   allocate(present(n))

   present = .false.

   do i =1, a

      present(list1(i)) = .true.

   end do

   ! Determine x (first element of the sequence)

   if (present(1)) then

      x =1

   else

      x =2

   end if

   ! Second part: compute count

   tmp = x

   x =0

   count =0

   do

      x = x + tmp

      if (x > 360) then

         x = x - 360

      end if

      count = count +1

      if (x == 360) exit

   end do

   ! Third part: process count as string

   ! Convert count to string

   write(count_str, '(i0)') count

   s_str = trim(count_str)

   m = len_trim(s_str)

   allocate(dp(0:m, 1:2)) ! since in Java it's 0-based, but Fortran can use 0 to m.

   dp = 0

   dp(0,1) =1

   do i =1, m

      current_char_ascii = ichar(s_str(i:i))

      if (current_char_ascii == ichar('0')) then

         ! first part: '0'

         dp(i,1) = dp(i-1,1)

         dp(i,2) = dp(i-1,2)

      else

         ! '1'

         dp(i,2) = mod( dp(i-1,1) + dp(i-1,2), M )

      end if

      ! second part

      if (current_char_ascii == ichar('0')) then

         ! add to second column

         temp = mod( dp(i-1,2)*2, M )

         dp(i,2) = mod( dp(i,2) + temp, M )

      else

         ! add to first and second columns

         temp0 = mod( dp(i-1,1)*2, M )

         temp1 = mod( dp(i-1,2)*2, M )

         dp(i,1) = mod( dp(i,1) + temp0, M )

         dp(i,2) = mod( dp(i,2) + temp1, M )

      end if

   end do

   ! The result is (dp(m,1) + dp(m,2)) mod M

   print*, mod( dp(m,1) + dp(m,2), M )

   deallocate(list1, present, dp)

end program main

program main

   implicit none

   integer, parameter :: M = 1000000007

   integer :: n, a, b, i, j, tmp, x, count, current_char_ascii

   integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: list1

   logical, dimension(:), allocatable :: present

   character(len=20) :: count_str

   character(len=20) :: s_str

   integer :: m

   integer, dimension(:,:), allocatable :: dp

   integer :: temp, temp0, temp1

   ! Read first part's input

   read*, n, a, b

   allocate(list1(a))

   read*, list1(1:a)

   allocate(present(n))

   present = .false.

   do i =1, a

      present(list1(i)) = .true.

   end do

   ! Determine x (first element of the sequence)

   if (present(1)) then

      x =1

   else

      x =2

   end if

   ! Second part: compute count

   tmp = x

   x =0

   count =0

   do

      x = x + tmp

      if (x > 360) then

         x = x - 360

      end if

      count = count +1

      if (x == 360) exit

   end do

   ! Third part: process count as string

   ! Convert count to string

   write(count_str, '(i0)') count

   s_str = trim(count_str)

   m = len_trim(s_str)

   allocate(dp(0:m, 1:2)) ! since in Java it's 0-based, but Fortran can use 0 to m.

   dp = 0

   dp(0,1) =1

   do i =1, m

      current_char_ascii = ichar(s_str(i:i))

      if (current_char_ascii == ichar('0')) then

         ! first part: '0'

         dp(i,1) = dp(i-1,1)

         dp(i,2) = dp(i-1,2)

      else

         ! '1' or other characters treated as '1'

         dp(i,2) = mod( dp(i-1,1) + dp(i-1,2), M )

      end if

      ! second part

      if (current_char_ascii == ichar('0')) then

         ! add to second column

         temp = mod( dp(i-1,2)*2, M )

         dp(i,2) = mod( dp(i,2) + temp, M )

      else

         ! add to first and second columns

         temp0 = mod( dp(i-1,1)*2, M )

         temp1 = mod( dp(i-1,2)*2, M )

         dp(i,1) = mod( dp(i,1) + temp0, M )

         dp(i,2) = mod( dp(i,2) + temp1, M )

      end if

   end do

   ! The result is (dp(m,1) + dp(m,2)) mod M

   print*, mod( dp(m,1) + dp(m,2), M )

   deallocate(list1, present, dp)

end program main
